main event: A bright blue-white light was observed traveling from the southeast to the northeast for approximately 15-20 seconds in Lawrenceburg, Indiana.
interesting points: The object was moving rapidly and disappeared like a star-shell., Echo I satellite was identified as the likely explanation for the sighting., The object was reported to be as bright as Venus and had no radar return., The observation occurred at night under cloudy conditions., No physical evidence was found for the sighting.
witness description: A 44-year-old male who reported having seen 5 or 6 similar objects previously.
